intro: Symplocos martii, commonly known as the red-flowered evergreen holly, is a species of flowering plant in the family Ericaceae. It is native to Southeast Asia, particularly found in regions of India, Nepal, and Bhutan. The plant is characterized by its glossy, dark green leaves and clusters of bright red flowers that bloom in the summer. Symplocos martii is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its attractive appearance and ability to thrive in shaded environments. It also plays a role in local ecosystems by providing habitat and food for various wildlife species.
